author: 8BrickMario
title: The Star of Series 3
review:
When I found the Series 3 Mixels, Torts was one I wanted the most. When I got him, I was very pleased.

Box/Instructions

The Mixels come in plastic packets like large-scale CMF bags. There is a nice vibrant image of the Mixel in question on the front, and their cartoon image along with their name is in the upper corner. The package has a cubit-shaped window in the front to view the parts. 

The instructions are obstructively folded in half, making it quite difficult to use without flattening them first. Bad move, LEGO.

 

Parts

This one has some great ones! The car part/"cockpit" element used for the front of his body isn't exclusive, but not common. The V-shaped car part in Green used on his head is exclusive, and his "nose" and the large leg "shells" are uncommon. He comes with the three-tooth plate, and the eye-print Technic balls. There are two pairs of ball joint pieces (2x1) for the legs. The best parts in the set are the two transparent neon green starfish, used as slime splats!

 

The build

The build is simple, but one lovely part of Torts' construction is his large legs. Why? It allows the ball and cup joints to be switched on his body, which grants his legs forward movement as well as outward! 

 

The completed model

Character and slime ooze from this Mixel. He has a great look, some brilliant parts usage, and just looks good.

Articulation

His arms fold left and right, and his legs can rotate forward/backward and outward. His eyeballs can be adjusted for different degrees of zaniness. Again, a lot of expressiveness here!

Overall opinion

This one is great. Terrific character, clever design, and overall fun make this the best Glorp Corp Mixel, and possibly the best one of Series 3!
